etymology.description: 臭 + 豆腐 = stinky tofu (fermented tofu snack).
etymology.interpretation: Literally ‘stinky tofu’, a direct descriptor for tofu fermented to develop a strong odor and distinctive flavor. Widely used across Sinosphere street-food contexts.

parts.english: tofu; bean curd; beancurd; soybean curd

examples.chinese: 我最爱夜市的臭豆腐(我最愛夜市的臭豆腐)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì ài yèshì de chòu dòufu.
examples.english: I love stinky tofu at the night market the most.

examples.chinese: 它闻起来很臭(它聞起來很臭)，但吃起来外酥里嫩(但吃起來外酥裡嫩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wén qǐlái hěn chòu, dàn chī qǐlái wài sū lǐ nèn.
examples.english: It smells very pungent, but it’s crispy outside and tender inside.

examples.chinese: 很多人一开始退后(很多人一開始退後)，吃了几口就喜欢了(吃了幾口就喜歡了)。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō rén yī kāishǐ tuìhòu, chī le jǐ kǒu jiù xǐhuan le.
examples.english: Many people step back at first, but after a few bites they start to like it.
